summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum dated July 23, 2019, reporting an interview with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione regarding an incident with his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein. Tartaglione describes waking to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, which prompted him to call for staff assistance.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: A pre-trial inmate housed in the Special Housing Unit at the time of the incident. He was interviewed about an encounter with his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein, where he woke to find Epstein staring at him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The cellmate of Nicholas Tartaglione. The document reports an incident where Tartaglione woke to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, which led Tartaglione to call for staff.

connections.description: Were housed together in a cell in the Special Housing Unit. Tartaglione reported an incident where Epstein was staring at him.

events.title: Interview regarding cell incident
events.description: An interview was conducted with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione regarding an incident that occurred with his cellmate, Jeffrey Epstein. Tartaglione reported waking to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him.

events.title: Tartaglione's last disciplinary incident
events.description: Nicholas Tartaglione's last incident report was for fighting with another inmate.

locations: 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007 (Federal Bureau of Prisons Office address)
Special Housing Unit (location within the prison where Tartaglione and Epstein were housed)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione as of July 23, 2019.
An incident occurred where Tartaglione woke to find Epstein sitting on the ground staring at him, prompting Tartaglione to call for staff assistance.
Nicholas Tartaglione was a pre-trial inmate facing charges including murder and drug conspiracy.
Tartaglione was in the SHU for possession of a cell phone.
The document is a confidential Bureau of Prisons memorandum reporting on an inmate interview.
